translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, leading to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly reproduces the behavior of a vacuum tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we present a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amplifier circuits, the VTX amplifiers are waiting with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.These amps also contain the multistage Valvetronix vacuum tube preamplifier. This is based on real analog circuits because these can better capture the sound variations and nuances of a vacuum tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system, from which the natural resonances only sputter.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can correct and exaggerate historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound exactly like you've always imagined. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is mainly due to the 2001 introduction of the VOX Valve Reactor-Technology. Since then, it has been continuously improved to meet new sound requirements, which led to a performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 with more dynamics and significantly improved amplifier models.The new VT+ Valvetronix series from VOX offers a range of options from the handheld VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, providing guitarists with a wide variety of sound options. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and quick response. During an incoming analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the end stage determines the character of the amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor Technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of a VT+- amplifier, which is equipped with a 12AX7 vacuum tube, perfectly captures the subtle nuances and sound character of a vacuum tube amplifier."

"Basketball-Bundesliga: Derby-Debakel of MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against the Merlins Crailsheim At least youngster Johannes Patrick was absent. Again nothing: For the second time in less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, John Patrick, the trainer of Ludwigsburg, looked back on the cup loss in early October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: \"We still have something anger in our stomach.\" However, this anger did not subside after the game - on the contrary, it increased even more due to the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Bundesliga basketball. Moreover, the way of appearance was even more disappointing than the naked result.A statistic can be called to represent the entire dilemma: The three-quote was only 13%, with 4 hits (all from young Johannes Patrick) out of 31 attempts - are there any more questions? The answer from John Patrick: \"We were not concentrated enough after the win in Tenerife and did not manage to implement what we had trained.\" Specifically, moving the ball.Sebastian Gleim's opponent reacted differently: \"Winning the game for the second time against Ludwigsburg is a great game,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" Although only 750 spectators were allowed in the Hohenlohe-Arena on Saturday, they were worth their money.Last but not least, thanks to BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team. \"The best point guard I've ever trained,\" praised Gleim. Meanwhile, in Patrick's team, the players like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) failed to perform throughout the game.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total debacle and come within eight points, after they had already fallen behind 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also contributed twelve points. Fortunately, there is still a lot of time left for squabbling.The Riesen received the Skyliners Frankfurt on Wednesday (8 pm), with a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg beforehand."

"In the name of the people: laypeople pass judgments while sitting in the courtroom in everyday clothing on the judge's bench. However, their judgment is crucial, even though they do not wear robes: jurors decide with professional judges whether and for how long someone is sentenced to prison.Two of them are reporting in conversation with the \"Public\" from their time at the Bad Kreuznacher Landgericht: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of the 125 lay judges at the Landgericht on John F. Kennedy Street."

translation1: "I am frustrated with Sky Sport F1. Hello F1 fans, throughout the season, the quality on German Sky has been decreasing, so I wanted to take a break from this post. First of all, today, during the F2 race, the transmission was interrupted to start the F1 pre-race show on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning of the time plan were far behind the planning, it was still possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision. It seems, however, that due to legal reasons the F1 priority is enjoyed and therefore everything else has to be restricted, so that Sky DE here had no choice. Stupid, especially since Sky UK has broadcasted the end of the race.Despite a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartyes has handled the difficult situation around the serious accident well. Then there was again a rule violation by the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, so both did not know that under a red flag the tires could be changed. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen could change the tires when they received corresponding radio messages from Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators knew immediately that there was a possibility of deviation. In my opinion, such fundamental rules should be known when commenting on F1 at a Pay-TV channel. It's also not the first time they've had to guess what's allowed or required by the rules, both of them have constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that it's a matter of taste. But honestly, I prefer Heiko Wasser from RTL even more. There are constant stupidities that both of them do, which make them look unprofessional, like ordering coffee from the (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The last one brings a lot of chaos to the comments, which he apparently doesn't take seriously. Last but not least, advertising takes over at Sky, in the final round Sky is the only broadcaster that goes into advertising, as we can hear at F1TV, where only the German audio track without commentary comes directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do that.These two channels make less advertising during training than Sky, and that as a free-TV channel. Although we have to praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, that alone does not make me overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the program of Sky Sport F1 is also very poor and full of repetitions.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-speaking channel that broadcasts F1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they still broadcast, except for advertising. So at least the grandiose F1 season makes less fun than it would with a reasonable broadcaster.I would like to hear your opinion once."
